channel.title: Interest-Rates on Archive 03
channel.description: Recent content in Interest-Rates on Archive 03

item.title: Fed's December Rate Decision Looms... Is a Santa Claus Rally Coming?
item.description: With the S&P 500 hovering around the 6,700 mark, all eyes are on the upcoming FOMC meeting scheduled for December 9-10. Recent dovish remarks from President John Williams have fueled expectations for a rate cut, but sticky 3% inflation and internal Fed divisions remain significant risks. Mew, Kurumi, and Mikael provide an in-depth analysis of the potential for a ‘Santa Claus Rally’ and the looming ’tariff risk’.

item.title: How to Start Investing in Bonds: Your Ally in a Bear Market?
item.description: Are bonds truly a safe haven when the stock market is volatile? From their negative correlation with stocks and predictable cash flow to the risks of interest rates and opportunity costs. Three unique characters break down everything you need to know about bond investing, including key ETFs like TLT, IEF, and AGG.

item.title: Why Did Trump Call Powell 'Stupid'?
item.description: President Trump has publicly criticized Fed Chair Powell, pressuring him to cut interest rates. Mew, Kurumi, and Mikael sharply analyze the current situation, where the hope for a short-term market boost clashes with the immense risk of undermining the central bank’s independence.
